Hello,

I just finished writing a JUnit test.  The test contains 5 values =
that
are initialized in setup and used to configure the class being tested.=


For example:

   protected void setUp() throws Exception
    {
       
  =
      priFacCost =3D 20789.0D;
        supFacCost =3D 4536.0D;
        supA=
dmPcnt =3D 5.7D;
        contPcnt =3D 5.0D;
        bidCostPcnt =3D 0.0D;

=
        pCostCalc =3D new ProjectCostCalculator( 
                priFacCos=
t,
                supFacCost,
                supAdmPcnt,
                =
contPcnt,      
                bidCostPcnt        
        );
    }

This =
was great... until I realized that I need at least 5-10
variations on the v=
alues in order to test what happens if a zero or a
null is included in the =
ProjectCostCalculator parms.  Any ideas on the
best way to approach test de=
sign when you need to run it multiple
times with different data configurati=
ons?

The more I thought about this, the more I'm wondering if there is a
k=
nown collection of JUnit test patterns.  Any thoughts on this?

Thank you i=
n advance -

Chris
